original: FRIMAN, Carl Algot, Konsul, Göteborg, f överums br, Kalm l, 31/8 81 av kamr P E F o Alma Miintzing, gm Elsa Biberg. Gbgs hdlsinst 97—99, Istbefex Falun 15, Istkaptex Gott-skär 29. Kont t 04, kont.ch fma A Karlson metall- o maskinAB Sthlm 04, styr.led där 08 o vkst dir 11, intendent (försäljn.ch) St Kopparb Bergsl AB Falun o Söderfors br Falukont 12, Övert grhdls- o ag.fma Ivar Miintzing & Co Gbg 15, ombild denna t AB 22, vkst dir f detta. V. ordf brandstyr, v. branden samt v. ordf fattigv.styr Stocksund 09—11; ch Falu Istkomp 14—15; Finl konsulf v:a Sv 19—26. Grund IF Kamraternas centralstyr o led av frns första skolungd.tävl i Sthlm, kass f E Bergvalls Idr.tidn 04, ordf Sv hdlsagis frns avd f Gbg o v:a Sv 41—43. Insp.res t Engl, Frankr, Ital, Österr, Tyskl mfl länd 12—15, aff.res i fi europ länd. Av trycket: Ett st antal brosch, prospekt o upps om tids- o kostn.bespar maskiner o mtrl f ind o hantv. Sv rek i löpn 150 m, nord mast på 100 m i Gävle o sv mast på d :o i Gbg 01, bästa fältskytt i Kopparb l 15. FinlFrKSkl, FinlVROlkl, 2 FinlMM fr 18 (Finl Vänners omb i v:a Sv 18), idr-, Skytte- o Istm g, Gbgs Istbeffrns ftjGM; Frimurare (VIII), Odd Fellow (veteranm). Hobbies: Odling och friluftsliv. Fma Ivar Muntzing & Co grund 85 av ing I M m spec eng o tyska ag i pappersmaskiner, filt, viror samt anilinfärger o har i Sv introduc titanvitt, oxanolja, lignostone, alfol-isolering mfl tekn metoder o material.
translated: FRIMAN, Carl Algot, Consul, Gothenburg, born in Överum parish, Kalmar county, on August 31, 1881, to P. E. F. and Alma Miintzing. Married to Elsa Biberg. Gothenburg commercial school 1897-1899, First Lieutenant in Falun 1915, First Captain in Gottskär 1929. Office clerk in 1904, head clerk in A. Karlson Metal and Machine AB in Stockholm 1904, board member and deputy director in 1911, superintendent (sales manager) at Kopparb Bergsl AB in Falun and Söderfors branch office in 1912, took over as manager and agency director of Ivar Miintzing & Co in Gothenburg in 1915, company converted to AB in 1922, and appointed as director of expansion. Vice chairman of the fire brigade, deputy fire chief, and vice chairman of the poor relief board in Stocksund 1909-1911; chairman of the Falun First Company 1914-1915; Finnish consul for western Sweden 1919-1926. Founder of the Kamraterna central committee and member of the first school youth competition in Stockholm, treasurer of E. Bergvalls' Sports Journal in 1904, chairman of the Swedish trade union's branch office in Gothenburg and western Sweden from 1941-1943. Inspector's trips to England, France, Italy, Austria, Germany, and other European countries from 1912-1915, business trips to several European countries. Notable publications: Several brochures, prospectuses, and articles on time and cost-saving machinery and materials in industry and craftsmanship. Swedish record holder in the 150m sprint, northern pole vault record of 100m in Gävle, and southern pole vault record of the same height in Gothenburg in 1901, the best field shooter in Kopparberg County in 1915. Awarded the Finnish Order of the Cross of Liberty, Finnish Order of the White Rose, and Second Class Military Medal of Finland in 1918 (appointed by Friends of Finland in western Sweden in 1918); member of sports, shooting, and ice skating associations; Gothenburg First Officer's Freemason (VIII) and Odd Fellow (veteran member). Hobbies: Gardening and outdoor activities. Ivar Muntzing & Co founded in 1885 by engineer I. M., specializing in paper machines, filters, saws, aniline dyes, and introduced titanium white, oxanol oil, lignostone, alfol insulation, and other technical methods and materials in Sweden.
